thread.title: NYPD Isn’t Properly Reporting Physical Contact With Public, Agency Says

author: Zolan Kanno-Youngs
title: NYPD Isn’t Properly Reporting Physical Contact With Public, Agency Says

organizations.name: agency says the new york police department

text:
The New York Police Department isn’t properly reporting physical encounters with the public, according to a report issued on Tuesday by a watchdog agency tasked with monitoring the department.
During a three-month period in 2017, police said on arrest reports that they didn’t use force in 55.9% of 136 arrests, but stated they used force during those same arrests on another form dedicated to forceful encounters, according to the Department of Investigation report.
